rev.comment: Rm per ship non-free images in list type article, per [[WP:NFLISTS]]. Article has been tagged with 'non-free' warning for 9 months. More on talk page.
rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1: â
{{non-free}}
 
{{Refimprove|date=March 2007}}
{{Refimprove|date=March 2007}}
The British television comedy '''''[[Red Dwarf]]''''' prominently features many different '''spaceships'''. Three feature regularly, and several have appeared for one or two episodes only but are nonetheless important to ''Red Dwarf'' continuity or well-known among the fan community. Dozens of spaceships have been seen only in one episode and no more. A few ships have also been mentioned but not seen.
The British television comedy '''''[[Red Dwarf]]''''' prominently features many different '''spaceships'''. Three feature regularly, and several have appeared for one or two episodes only but are nonetheless important to ''Red Dwarf'' continuity or well-known among the fan community. Dozens of spaceships have been seen only in one episode and no more. A few ships have also been mentioned but not seen.
Line 5: Line 4:
==Main ships==
==Main ships==
===Red Dwarf===
===Red Dwarf===
â
[[File:RedDwarfShipOriginal.jpg|thumb|right|The second physical ''Red Dwarf'' model built for Series V and destroyed by pyrotechnics for the episode ''Demons and Angels''.{{Citation needed|date=July 2009}}]]
  â
[[File:RedDwarfShip.jpg|thumb|right|The CGI ''Red Dwarf'' used for the remastered versions of Series IâIII and (with a higher-quality render) for Series VIII. Nicknamed "the pencil" by fans due to its length.{{Citation needed|date=July 2009}}]]
  â  
The eponymous spaceship '''''Red Dwarf''''' is an enormous mining vessel owned by the Jupiter Mining Corporation and commanded by Captain [[Red Dwarf characters#Captain Frank Hollister|Frank Hollister]]. It is 6 miles (10 km) long, 5 miles (8 km) tall, and 4 miles (6 km) wide.<ref>{{cite book | last =Grant | first =Rob | authorlink = | coauthors =Doug Naylor | title =Red Dwarf Infinity Welcomes Careful Drivers | publisher =Penguin Books | date =1989 | location = | pages = | url = | doi = | id = | isbn =978-0-14-012437-8 }}</ref> The jagged shape and dull red colour of the vessel has led to the vessel being described as a "giant red trash can". All of ''Red Dwarf'''s systems are controlled by the computer [[Red Dwarf characters#Holly|Holly]].
The eponymous spaceship '''''Red Dwarf''''' is an enormous mining vessel owned by the Jupiter Mining Corporation and commanded by Captain [[Red Dwarf characters#Captain Frank Hollister|Frank Hollister]]. It is 6 miles (10 km) long, 5 miles (8 km) tall, and 4 miles (6 km) wide.<ref>{{cite book | last =Grant | first =Rob | authorlink = | coauthors =Doug Naylor | title =Red Dwarf Infinity Welcomes Careful Drivers | publisher =Penguin Books | date =1989 | location = | pages = | url = | doi = | id = | isbn =978-0-14-012437-8 }}</ref> The jagged shape and dull red colour of the vessel has led to the vessel being described as a "giant red trash can". All of ''Red Dwarf'''s systems are controlled by the computer [[Red Dwarf characters#Holly|Holly]].
Line 43: Line 39:
===Blue Midget===
===Blue Midget===
â
[[File:RedDwarfBlueMidget.jpg|thumb|right|''Blue Midget'', original version; described as being "like a bread van" by Ed Bye on the "Re-Dwarf" documentary<ref>http://www.reddwarfbodysnatcher.com/content.php</ref>]]
  â  
'''''Blue Midget'''''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=bluemidget |title=Blue Midget | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> is a type of shuttle which ''Red Dwarf'' carries. Its [[fuselage]] resembles that of a [[CH-47 Chinook|Chinook]] [[helicopter]], although it also has features of a truck or [[tank]] (as it features [[caterpillar tracks]] and a bumper sticker that reads "My Other Space Ship is a Red Dwarf"), and its cockpit can hold a maximum of four people. ''Blue Midget'' was the only shuttlecraft used for Series II. By Series III, and the introduction of Kryten as a main character, a bigger shuttle was needed and ''Blue Midget'' faded into the background, only featuring in two episodes of Series III and not showing up at all again until Series VIII.
'''''Blue Midget'''''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=bluemidget |title=Blue Midget | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> is a type of shuttle which ''Red Dwarf'' carries. Its [[fuselage]] resembles that of a [[CH-47 Chinook|Chinook]] [[helicopter]], although it also has features of a truck or [[tank]] (as it features [[caterpillar tracks]] and a bumper sticker that reads "My Other Space Ship is a Red Dwarf"), and its cockpit can hold a maximum of four people. ''Blue Midget'' was the only shuttlecraft used for Series II. By Series III, and the introduction of Kryten as a main character, a bigger shuttle was needed and ''Blue Midget'' faded into the background, only featuring in two episodes of Series III and not showing up at all again until Series VIII.
â
[[File:Midget800x600.jpg|thumb|left|The redesigned ''Blue Midget'', as seen in ''Red Dwarf Remastered'', with arms and legs replacing its caterpillar tracks. As with the new CG ''Red Dwarf'' model, this was also utilised for Series VIII, where it had a higher rendering quality.]]
 
For ''[[Red Dwarf Remastered]]'', ''Blue Midget'' was completely redesigned to resemble a bubble car with retractable legs used for taking off and walking (replacing the caterpillar tracks).
For ''[[Red Dwarf Remastered]]'', ''Blue Midget'' was completely redesigned to resemble a bubble car with retractable legs used for taking off and walking (replacing the caterpillar tracks).
Line 66: Line 59:
Throughout Series VI and VII, ''Starbug'' is regularly seen travelling through different [[planetary system]]s and through completely different regions of the [[interstellar medium]] within short periods of time. Thus it stands to reason that ''Starbug'' is capable of [[interstellar travel]].{{Citation needed|date=March 2009}}
Throughout Series VI and VII, ''Starbug'' is regularly seen travelling through different [[planetary system]]s and through completely different regions of the [[interstellar medium]] within short periods of time. Thus it stands to reason that ''Starbug'' is capable of [[interstellar travel]].{{Citation needed|date=March 2009}}
â   â
[[File:Starbug800x600.jpg|thumb|left|200px|The redesigned, CG ''Starbug'', as featured in Series VII. Note the smaller cockpit window and backward-angled legs.]]
 
For Series VII, ''Starbug'' was redesigned again, partially rendered in [[Computer-generated imagery|CGI]], and the sets were made substantially larger (the ''Starbug'' of Series VII was apparently similar to the [[TARDIS]] in ''[[Doctor Who]]'', being larger on the inside than outside). The complex explanation on this occasion for the redesign was due to a [[time paradox]] caused by the battle with their future selves at the finale of the previous series (see episodes "[[Out of Time (Red Dwarf)|Out of Time]]" and "[[Tikka to Ride]]"). Kryten explains that "dimensional anomalies" caused by this [[time paradox]] had expanded the engineering section, the cargo bay section and the maintenance ducts by over 212%. Apparently parts of the upgraded future version of ''Starbug'' from the timeline they erased also came to co-exist with the present ''Starbug''.
For Series VII, ''Starbug'' was redesigned again, partially rendered in [[Computer-generated imagery|CGI]], and the sets were made substantially larger (the ''Starbug'' of Series VII was apparently similar to the [[TARDIS]] in ''[[Doctor Who]]'', being larger on the inside than outside). The complex explanation on this occasion for the redesign was due to a [[time paradox]] caused by the battle with their future selves at the finale of the previous series (see episodes "[[Out of Time (Red Dwarf)|Out of Time]]" and "[[Tikka to Ride]]"). Kryten explains that "dimensional anomalies" caused by this [[time paradox]] had expanded the engineering section, the cargo bay section and the maintenance ducts by over 212%. Apparently parts of the upgraded future version of ''Starbug'' from the timeline they erased also came to co-exist with the present ''Starbug''.
Line 81: Line 72:
====Carbug====
====Carbug====
â
[[File:Carbug.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Carbug on the set of ''[[Coronation Street]]'', as featured in "Back to Earth"]]
 
'''Carbug''' is featured in ''[[Red Dwarf: Back to Earth]]''. Designed by Mark Harris,<ref>Mark Harris IMDb http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0365052/</ref> it is a customised [[Smart Fortwo]] that is coated in green vinyl in the same green as the original Starbug; it also has various added engines and wings to make it look like the ''Bug''. [[Chris Barrie]] (doing his best [[Jeremy Clarkson]] impersonation) made a spoof ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]'' style feature about Carbug for the official Dave website.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dave.uktv.co.uk/library/red-dwarf/red-dwarf-exclusive-videos-chris-barrie-carbug/ |title=Red Dwarf Exclusive Videos: Chris Barrie on Carbug |publisher=Dave.uktv.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2009-03-26}}</ref> In the episode, the Dwarfers find themselves in a hallucination caused by a [[Back to Reality (Red Dwarf)|despair squid]]. In this delusional state, they borrow Carbug from Swallow, a maker of movie props, in order to track down their creator after discovering that they are in fact fictional characters who have somehow escaped from a TV show called ''Red Dwarf''. It was developed by the Red Dwarf fan club president and stolen by Swallow at the end of series IX.
'''Carbug''' is featured in ''[[Red Dwarf: Back to Earth]]''. Designed by Mark Harris,<ref>Mark Harris IMDb http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0365052/</ref> it is a customised [[Smart Fortwo]] that is coated in green vinyl in the same green as the original Starbug; it also has various added engines and wings to make it look like the ''Bug''. [[Chris Barrie]] (doing his best [[Jeremy Clarkson]] impersonation) made a spoof ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]'' style feature about Carbug for the official Dave website.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dave.uktv.co.uk/library/red-dwarf/red-dwarf-exclusive-videos-chris-barrie-carbug/ |title=Red Dwarf Exclusive Videos: Chris Barrie on Carbug |publisher=Dave.uktv.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2009-03-26}}</ref> In the episode, the Dwarfers find themselves in a hallucination caused by a [[Back to Reality (Red Dwarf)|despair squid]]. In this delusional state, they borrow Carbug from Swallow, a maker of movie props, in order to track down their creator after discovering that they are in fact fictional characters who have somehow escaped from a TV show called ''Red Dwarf''. It was developed by the Red Dwarf fan club president and stolen by Swallow at the end of series IX.
Line 92: Line 82:
===White Midget===
===White Midget===
â
[[File:Whitemidget.png|thumb|left|''White Midget'' approaching ''Red Dwarf'', as seen in "[[Ouroboros (Red Dwarf)|Ouroboros]]".]]
 
'''''White Midget'''''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=whitemidget |title=White Midget | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> was going to be the second type of shuttle held aboard ''Red Dwarf'' in addition to ''Blue Midget'' - the introduction of the character Kryten necessitated the introduction of a larger shuttle. ''White Midget'' went through at least one redesign in the concept stage, which changed it to the shape of three spheres like the segments of a bug. It was later renamed ''Green Midget'' and later still ''Starbug''.
'''''White Midget'''''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=whitemidget |title=White Midget | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> was going to be the second type of shuttle held aboard ''Red Dwarf'' in addition to ''Blue Midget'' - the introduction of the character Kryten necessitated the introduction of a larger shuttle. ''White Midget'' went through at least one redesign in the concept stage, which changed it to the shape of three spheres like the segments of a bug. It was later renamed ''Green Midget'' and later still ''Starbug''.
Line 107: Line 96:
==Guest ships==
==Guest ships==
===''Nova 5''===
===''Nova 5''===
â
[[File:RedDwarfNova5.jpg|thumb|200px|right|''Nova 5'' wreckage.]]
 
The wreck of the '''''Nova 5'''''<ref name="encounters1">{{cite web|author=skbromley |url=http://dave.uktv.co.uk/library/red-dwarf/red-dwarf-feature-close-encounters/ |title=Red Dwarf feature: Close encounters |publisher=Dave.uktv.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=novav |title=Nova V | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> was discovered in the Series II episode "[[Kryten (Red Dwarf episode)|Kryten]]", and is in fact the first spacecraft seen in the show apart from ''Red Dwarf'' itself.
The wreck of the '''''Nova 5'''''<ref name="encounters1">{{cite web|author=skbromley |url=http://dave.uktv.co.uk/library/red-dwarf/red-dwarf-feature-close-encounters/ |title=Red Dwarf feature: Close encounters |publisher=Dave.uktv.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=novav |title=Nova V | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> was discovered in the Series II episode "[[Kryten (Red Dwarf episode)|Kryten]]", and is in fact the first spacecraft seen in the show apart from ''Red Dwarf'' itself.
Line 124: Line 112:
===The DNA Ship===
===The DNA Ship===
â
[[File:Aliendnaship.png|thumb|right|The DNA ship.]]
 
All that is known of its origins is that it was from a later period of Earth's history and crewed by a human â who died after the [[DNA]]-transforming machine on board caused him to grow three heads.<ref name="encounters1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=dnaship |title=DNA Ship | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref>
All that is known of its origins is that it was from a later period of Earth's history and crewed by a human â who died after the [[DNA]]-transforming machine on board caused him to grow three heads.<ref name="encounters1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=dnaship |title=DNA Ship | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref>
Line 136: Line 123:
===''Wildfire''===
===''Wildfire''===
â
[[File:Ace-ship.jpg|thumb|left|The original, model ''Wildfire'', from "Dimension Jump"]]
  â
[[File:Cgwildfire.png|thumb|right|The ''Wildfire'', as seen in "Stoke Me A Clipper"]]
 
'''''Wildfire''''' is [[Red Dwarf characters#Ace Rimmer|Ace Rimmer's]] personal ship.<ref name="encounters1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=wildfire |title=Wildfire | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> ''Wildfire'' is a one-man craft with only a cockpit, and is run by a computer who has a crush on Ace Rimmer. It first appeared in the episode "[[Dimension Jump (Red Dwarf episode)|Dimension Jump]]", which also introduced Ace Rimmer. Its second appearance was in the episode "[[Stoke Me a Clipper]]", where it was slightly redesigned, being small enough to fit inside ''Starbug'''s [[hangar]].
'''''Wildfire''''' is [[Red Dwarf characters#Ace Rimmer|Ace Rimmer's]] personal ship.<ref name="encounters1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=wildfire |title=Wildfire | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> ''Wildfire'' is a one-man craft with only a cockpit, and is run by a computer who has a crush on Ace Rimmer. It first appeared in the episode "[[Dimension Jump (Red Dwarf episode)|Dimension Jump]]", which also introduced Ace Rimmer. Its second appearance was in the episode "[[Stoke Me a Clipper]]", where it was slightly redesigned, being small enough to fit inside ''Starbug'''s [[hangar]].
Line 147: Line 132:
===SSS ''Esperanto''===
===SSS ''Esperanto''===
â
[[File:SSSEsperanto.png|thumb|SSS ''Esperanto'']]
 
The SSS '''''Esperanto'''''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=esperantoss |title=Esperanto, SS | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> was a designated "{{dn|Seeding|ocean seeding ship}}" featured in "[[Back to Reality (Red Dwarf)|Back to Reality]]", the last episode of Series V.
The SSS '''''Esperanto'''''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=esperantoss |title=Esperanto, SS | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> was a designated "{{dn|Seeding|ocean seeding ship}}" featured in "[[Back to Reality (Red Dwarf)|Back to Reality]]", the last episode of Series V.
Line 159: Line 143:
===The Simulant Battle Cruiser===
===The Simulant Battle Cruiser===
â
[[File:Simulantship.png|thumb|left|The unnamed Simulant ship.]]
 
This unnamed vessel appears in two episodes of Series VI: "[[Gunmen of the Apocalypse]]" and "[[Rimmerworld]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=roguesimulantvessel |title=Rogue Simulant Vessel | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> It is crewed by [[Red Dwarf characters#Simulants|Rogue Simulants]] who roam deep space, looking for other vessels to hunt or compete with in battle for the purposes of [[sport]], and occasionally to capture humans to [[torture]] for their sadistic pleasure. It contains a number of components looted from other vessels, including an escape pod taken from a [[Terraforming|seeding ship]]. It also incorporated a great deal of advanced technology (most notably a [[teleporter]]) and a large store of [[food]] in order to sustain the Simulants' torture victims.
This unnamed vessel appears in two episodes of Series VI: "[[Gunmen of the Apocalypse]]" and "[[Rimmerworld]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=roguesimulantvessel |title=Rogue Simulant Vessel | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> It is crewed by [[Red Dwarf characters#Simulants|Rogue Simulants]] who roam deep space, looking for other vessels to hunt or compete with in battle for the purposes of [[sport]], and occasionally to capture humans to [[torture]] for their sadistic pleasure. It contains a number of components looted from other vessels, including an escape pod taken from a [[Terraforming|seeding ship]]. It also incorporated a great deal of advanced technology (most notably a [[teleporter]]) and a large store of [[food]] in order to sustain the Simulants' torture victims.
Line 184: Line 167:
===''Enlightenment''===<!-- This section is linked from [[Salute]] -->
===''Enlightenment''===<!-- This section is linked from [[Salute]] -->
â
[[File:HoloshipEnlightnment.png|thumb|200px|right|The ''Enlightenment'']]
 
The '''''Enlightenment'''''<ref name="encounters1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=enlightenmentholoship |title=Enlightenment (Holoship) | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> only appears once, in the episode "[[Holoship]]" (Series V, Episode 1). In the commentary for this episode Danny John-Jules amusingly gasps when the characters refer to the ''Enlightenment'' as "a computer generated ship". It was in fact a model made of transparent plastic. In the Series V extras DVD, there are unused clips of the ''Enlightenment'' bending its main structure about its articulation points; no other ship in the ''Red Dwarf'' series is known to do this.
The '''''Enlightenment'''''<ref name="encounters1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reddwarf.co.uk/database/index.cfm?section=ships&entry=enlightenmentholoship |title=Enlightenment (Holoship) | Ships, Shuttles & Stations | Space Corps Database |publisher=Red Dwarf |date= |accessdate=2009-03-19}}</ref> only appears once, in the episode "[[Holoship]]" (Series V, Episode 1). In the commentary for this episode Danny John-Jules amusingly gasps when the characters refer to the ''Enlightenment'' as "a computer generated ship". It was in fact a model made of transparent plastic. In the Series V extras DVD, there are unused clips of the ''Enlightenment'' bending its main structure about its articulation points; no other ship in the ''Red Dwarf'' series is known to do this.
